meanings.definition: Lithosols: a type of soil consisting of a thin layer of weathered rock fragments
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted his crops in the lithosols, hoping the rock fragments would provide good drainage.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the lithosols to understand how weathered rock fragments affect soil composition.
meanings.sent3: The lithosols were so rocky that even the earthworms struggled to dig through them.
meanings.sent4: The lithosols resembled a mosaic of tiny pebbles, creating a unique patchwork on the ground.
meanings.sent5: Walking on the lithosols felt like stepping on a gravel pathway in a garden.

meanings.definition: Lithosols: soils with a high proportion of rock fragments and little organic material
meanings.sent1: The construction workers encountered lithosols while digging the foundation, slowing down the process.
meanings.sent2: Gardening in lithosols can be challenging due to the lack of organic material for plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The lithosols in the garden were so barren that even the weeds refused to grow there.
meanings.sent4: The lithosols seemed like a rocky desert landscape, devoid of any signs of life.
meanings.sent5: The lithosols appeared like a jigsaw puzzle of rocks waiting to be assembled into a garden.
